author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of the Joint Action Council of Tamil Nadu Teachers’ Organisations staging a protest in Tiruchi on Sunday.— Photo: M. Srinath

Members of the Joint Action Council of Tamil Nadu Teachers’ Organisations (JACTTO) continued their strike for the second consecutive day on Sunday.

A total of 300 members, including 110 women were arrested when they attempted to stage a road roko here in support of their demands. They were prevented by the police when they attempted to stage road roko on Collector’s office road.

Their 15-point charter of demands include salary on a par with the Union government teachers, addressing Sixth Pay Commission discrimination, implementation of Tamil-medium education from primary to secondary education in all schools in the State, scrapping teacher eligibility test, and appointing teachers based on seniority. All of them were released in the evening.

In Ariyalur, as many as 210 teachers courted arrest. In Perambalur, as many as 480 teachers who attempted to picket the Collector’s Office courted arrest. In Pudukottai, the teachers resorted to road roko in front of the Public Office. Police rushed to the spot and 496 persons courted arrest.
title: Teachers continue their protest
